com.remote.remote2d.engine

Class DisplayHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.remote.remote2d.engine.DisplayHandler

  • public class DisplayHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    Responsible for all handling of LWJGL's Display as well as any initial OpenGL calls. This class is also responsible for maintaining resolution independence with StretchType
    Author:
    Flafla2

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DisplayHandler(int width, int height, int gameWidth, int gameHeight, StretchType type, boolean fullscreen, boolean borderless)

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void checkDisplayResolution()
      Checks to see if the display has been resized.
      boolean getBorderless()
      If the game is in borderless mode.
      NOTE: Borderless doesn't work on Macs, and it doesn't work when fullscreen mode is on at the same time!
      java.nio.ByteBuffer getBufferFromImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image, int BYTES_PER_PIXEL)
      Creates a ByteBuffer from an image.
      Vector2 getDefaultDimensions()

      The ratio of the OpenGL camera size and the window size.

      A ColliderBox representing the renderable area of the game, in window coordinates (NOT OpenGL/game coordinates).

      Initializes OpenGL.

      Sets the StretchType of the game.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DisplayHandler

        public DisplayHandler(int width,
              int height,
              int gameWidth,
              int gameHeight,
              StretchType type,
              boolean fullscreen,
              boolean borderless)

    • Method Detail

      • setIcons

        public void setIcons(java.lang.String[] icons)

      • getDimensions

        public Vector2 getDimensions()
        The renderable dimensions of the game right now (in pixels).

      • getDefaultDimensions

        public Vector2 getDefaultDimensions()
        The default renderable dimensions of the game (in pixels). In other words this ignores any Gui overrides to the StretchType.

      • getScreenDimensions

        public Vector2 getScreenDimensions()
        The dimensions of the screen - NOT the game. In other words this includes the black bars/box around the game when the StretchType isn't StretchType.NONE.

      • getFullscreen

        public boolean getFullscreen()
        If the game is in full screen

      • getStretchType

        public StretchType getStretchType()
        The current StretchType of the game.
        See Also:
        StretchType

      • getBorderless

        public boolean getBorderless()
        If the game is in borderless mode.
        NOTE: Borderless doesn't work on Macs, and it doesn't work when fullscreen mode is on at the same time!

      • getBufferFromImage

        public java.nio.ByteBuffer getBufferFromImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image,
                                     int BYTES_PER_PIXEL)
        Creates a ByteBuffer from an image. This is used by LWJGL low level utilities.
        Parameters:
        image - Image to convert
        BYTES_PER_PIXEL - How many bytes in 1 pixel - 4 for RGBA, 3 for RGB

      • checkDisplayResolution

        public void checkDisplayResolution()
        Checks to see if the display has been resized. If it has, reinitializes OpenGL.

      • getRenderScale

        public Vector2 getRenderScale()
        The ratio of the OpenGL camera size and the window size.

      • initGL

        public void initGL()
        Initializes OpenGL. This must be done whenever the Display window is reset (when it is resized, toggled into fullscreen, etc.) as well as when the game first launches.

      • getScreenRenderArea

        public ColliderBox getScreenRenderArea()
        A ColliderBox representing the renderable area of the game, in window coordinates (NOT OpenGL/game coordinates).

      • setGameResolution

        public void setGameResolution(int resx,
                     int resy,
                     StretchType stretch)
        Sets the target resolution and Stretch Type of the game. This is relatively expensive (requires reloading OpenGL and therefore all pictures) so use this sparingly.
        Parameters:
        resx - The target width of the game
        resy - The target height of the game
        stretch - Sets the stretch mode of the game
        See Also:
        StretchType

      • setStretchType

        public void setStretchType(StretchType stretch)
        Sets the StretchType of the game.
        NOTE: DO NOT use this unless you have to! Usually you can use GuiMenu.getOverrideStretchType()!

      • setDisplayMode

        public void setDisplayMode(int width,
                  int height,
                  boolean fullscreen,
                  boolean borderless)
        Set the display mode to be used
        Parameters:
        width - The width of the display required
        height - The height of the display required
        fullscreen - If we want fullscreen mode
        borderless - If we want the window to be borderless

      • getLastTexReload

        public long getLastTexReload()
        The time, in milliseconds since the last OpenGL reload. At this time, all textures clear and must be reloaded.
        Returns:
        The time in milliseconds.
